intro: Diaphoranthema triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
